verses.name: Proverbs 5:1
verses.text: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:

verses.name: Proverbs 5:2
verses.text: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:3
verses.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

verses.name: Proverbs 5:4
verses.text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:5
verses.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:6
verses.text: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
